p.s: In his article We are entering an era of pandemics - it will end only when we protect the rainforest one of Peter Daszak's possible solutions for stopping future pandemics is to not return to a system of unchecked consumption following the corona crisis.
Will we really forego our consumptious lifestyle just to maybe prevent future pandemics?
While one could say that Covid-19 happened because of our consumption and would be partly right, I think that for many people that concept is hard to grasp.
There is somply too much focus on consumption of goods in modern socety, that most people could live without it.
The whole concept of capitalism os bared on the will of people to acquire things.
The question is, how much would we need to change in our daily loves to make a difference on the environment?
Many people are too lazy to even seperate garbage, so how much can you expect of them.
Of course some or even most people would be able to change their lifestyle to help the environment, but the problem is, that everyone would have to do it.
The changes would have to become the new norm in society, which is hard and takes a long time.
It took in long time for example for society to accept regulations due to Covid-19.
It would take much education by the government about the consequences of overconsumption.
In conclusion I think it is unlikely that mankind will not return to a system of unchecked consumption, because of stubbornness and the basic structure of capitalism, that promotes consumption.
